p: Despite the advancement of medicine, diarrheal diseases are still the second leading cause of death among children under the age of five. [ 1] Globally, herbal medicines account for 80% of the healthcare needs of the majority of developing countries. [ 2] Even though the drug manufacturing industry has developed a large number of drugs, indigenous phytotherapy is still practiced in several rural areas, using treatments handed down from generation to generation. [ 3] In Ethiopia, about 80% of populations relied on traditional medicine due to the cultural acceptability, relatively low cost of traditional medicine, and limited access to modern health facilities.
